content.rendered:
Photo by Scott Penner (Dove photo used on social media by Liz West)

I imagine there’s been a ton of websites designed and a ton of code developed while listening to music by Prince. This week we lost one of the great artists of all time…thank you for all that you’ve given us! RIP Prince.

Onto the latest #genesiswp news, with a great opportunity to talk to Brian Gardner (yes, that Brian Gardner), a new theme release, lots of great showcase work and some tutorials to help you along the way.

Hire Brian!

Without Brian Gardner there would be no #genesiswp and we wouldn’t have this vibrant community! Here’s your chance to show your appreciation, while at the same time helping yourself.

Brian is running a campaign to raise $5,000 for orphan care, and to support his good friend and founder of The Hope Effect, Joshua Becker.

Until June 1, 2016, you can donate $250 to his campaign. Besides helping a worthy cause, you get an hour of Brian’s time to pick his brain. I was able to donate and spend an hour talking with Brian on a previous campaign and it was such a great experience…I can’t recommend it enough.

You can visit Brian’s website to learn more and donate to a worthy cause:

Hire Me

Themes

We’ve had quite a run on beautiful new themes released this year, and this week we have another to add, as well as teasers for two more.

Chris Hufnagel introduced his new KeepSimple them, now available for purchase:

Need a simple WordPress theme for #GenesisWP? Great to build off or as a standalone site! https://t.co/I2HEk7NcEZ pic.twitter.com/7SkaxQPBuj

— Sminso (@SminsoHQ) April 21, 2016

Susan Nelson gave us a preview of her new theme, almost ready for release:

Almost ready to release a new #genesiswp theme! This is how I've been spending some of my weekends. 🙂 pic.twitter.com/HST9buyoJy

— Susan Nelson (@OhHelloDesigns) April 21, 2016

…and Anita gave us a teaser for her upcoming theme named “Isabelle” (beautiful name), in honor of her mom! Can’t wait to see it…

So excited! Releasing my new #GenesisWP theme named after my mom – "Isabelle" next week. Been working on this a long time. #IMissYouMom.

— Cre8tiveDiva (@TheCre8tiveDiva) April 20, 2016

Showcase

It’s so nice to be part of the #genesiswp community and see the amazing work released by such talented people each week. This week is no different, with these websites to showcase:

The one-and-only Rebecca Gill releasing this new website, showing what an impact the right images can make:

High quality images are everything. You can see it in our #genesiswp website launch for https://t.co/OS5Lqs5Lrf. pic.twitter.com/OasEiReqZY

— Rebecca Gill (@rebeccagill) April 19, 2016

Andrea Whitmer is on a roll this week with two new custom websites introduced to the world. The first one designed by Archer Creative:

Also launched a custom #genesiswp member site for @PreKPages (design by @Archer_Creative) https://t.co/W2jMXHqXOj pic.twitter.com/iV7W39cNuu

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) April 18, 2016

…and the second one with help from Liz Theresa on the design side:

Launched a custom #genesiswp theme for @YoungAdultMoney this weekend (design by @LizTheresa) https://t.co/YBlBt3RrZr pic.twitter.com/af3waAjVN0

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) April 18, 2016

Bloom Blog Shop introduced its stunning new design:

Calvin Koepke and Gray Beltran with one of the best sites you’ll see on Genesis, blankonblank.org

Happy to have launched a new custom #genesiswp site for @blankonblank last night: https://t.co/Ncewp6qw2n (design by @graybeltran)

— ⚒ Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) April 19, 2016

And, Murray Anderson-Clemence with a great site based on Author Pro for suprite.com.au

Best of the rest

Know the Code released another Genesis “hands-on code lab” diving into the Genesis Header structure:

Let's customize the site title in #genesiswp. Step-by-step, thoroughly explained hands-on lab. https://t.co/K5NmcvZbWZ

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) April 19, 2016

Neil Gee is on a roll with another great tutorial, this one about using the WordPress new custom logo support with Genesis:

Using the new #WordPress custom-logo theme support with #GenesisWP https://t.co/PUKALT0LaD

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) April 16, 2016

Tara Claeys represented Genesis well by wearing her #genesiswp swag for her talk about membership websites:

Flaunting my swag at my talk on membership websites #genesiswp #swag pic.twitter.com/FNWidJo0OL

— Tara Claeys (@design_tlc) April 20, 2016

I’m looking forward to getting my own #genesiswp swag one day 😉

Pretty Darn Cute Designs put together this simple tutorial for enabling Pinterest Rich Pins in Genesis to help build your brand.

https://www.facebook.com/studiopress/posts/1540513685962305

This week in Srikat’s Corner we have:

Updated https://t.co/ZDXm1czbF3 w/ alternate code for front-page.php for showing Primary Sidebar to the right of widget areas on front page.

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) April 16, 2016

How to add Favorites feature for your site's users in Genesis:https://t.co/QRJ7lAHiAt#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/9J82XuICvk

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) April 17, 2016

That’s it for this week! Another week of inspiration and education, and Tax Season (in the US) is officially behind us 🙂 Have a great weekend everybody!

PS If you didn’t read the interview and enter the giveaway from Tonya Mork to win one year of Know The Code membership yet, you’d better get to it!

PPS Next week it’s GenesisWP.guide’s one birthday and Nick will finally be unveiling the much talked about, little worked on new features of GenesisWP.guide (join the beta list to hear about it first).

excerpt.rendered: A great opportunity to talk to Brian Gardner (and support a great cause), a new theme release, lots of great showcase work and some tutorials to help you along the way.
